description: page from a book (pages 35 and 36); recto, top image: large Victorian houses; house on left is brick, house on right is wood frame; figures on sidewalk, in front of houses and on porch of house at right; carriages on street; "RESIDENCE OF C. H. BIGELOW, COLLEGE AVENUE, ST PAUL, MINN." and "RESIDENCE OF E. M. DEANE, COLLEGE AVENUE, ST PAUL, MINN." printed below image; recto, bottom image: factory complex with three buildings, with figures, horses and carriages around them; lumber at right; trains in LLC and center left; "ST. PAUL HARVESTER WORKS" and other text printed below image; verso, top image: large Victorian house with cupola and fountain in front; figures in front of house; carriages and horses on street; "J. C. BURBANK'S RESIDENCE, SUMMIT AVE. / ST. PAUL, MINN." printed below image; verso, bottom image: Victorian house with figures on street; two horses and carriages; "RESIDENCE OF R. BARDEN, COR. 6TH & MARIA AVE. DAYTONS BLUFF, ST PAUL, MINN." printed below image
provenance: [W. Graham Arader III, Philadelphia, until 2005; sold in October, for I(3)OO, to Drake]; Harry Drake, St. Paul (2005-d.2012; bequeathed to MIA)
title: St. Paul Harvester Works from "An Illustrated Historical Atlas of the State of Minnesota," 1874
